marklogic.body:
Spot on, but I'd add a couple caveats, which are interrelated: -->The devil's in the details: exactly what you choose to measure is important. -->Metrics must measure something spcific that you can Act on.
An excellent summary can be found here: http://500hats.typepad.com/500blogs/2007/09/startup-metrics.html
The basic idea is that you need to choose what to measure and measure it in such a way (i.e., using cohort analysis) so that you know exactly what teh result of your efforts was. The idea is to use real-world data to make business decisions, instead of intuition or some other soft judgement.
Greg Miliates http://www.StartMyConsultingBusiness.com/start-here/
